title: [$250] Skip unnecessary createOptionList call on app startup

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from a proposal [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1763108178873179) ### Background OptionListContext is initialised when the user visits any search page for the first time, and its main job is to ensure a fast initial load while also efficiently managing shared data. It also handles building chat and attendee suggestions using large Onyx datasets. Screens only call the heavy lifting function, initializeOptions(), when they are fully ready to pay the performance cost. ### Problem When app is opened, createOptionList is being called unnecessarily, which leads to slower app startup. ### Solution Add a guard in the locale-change effect so it exits until areOptionsInitialized.current is true. [DraftPR](https://github.com/Expensify/App/pull/75054) Performance: Speeds up the app start on large accounts for ~500-1000ms depending on a size of account
Issue OwnerCurrent Issue Owner: @Krishna2323

  • Upwork Job ID: 1989292788777808322

title: [$250] Encapsulate Magic Code Countdown to Prevent Form Re-renders

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
Coming from [here](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C05LX9D6E07/p1762954917115639) ### Background: BaseValidateCodeForm currently orchestrates every sign-in state, subscribing to account, credential, and locale Onyx keys while presenting resend messaging governed by CONST.REQUEST_CODE_DELAY so customers know when they can request another code. ### Problem: When BaseValidateCodeForm owns the resend countdown state and the timer decrements each second, if the countdown updates, then the whole sign-in form re-renders. ### Solution: Factor the resend countdown into a dedicated ValidateCodeCountdown component that manages its own timer state so the form only re-renders on actual authentication state changes. Performance Impact: - SignIn: The total duration of rendering during the entire countdown sequence was reduced ~57% (288ms -> 141ms) - After register: The total duration of rendering during the entire countdown sequence was reduced ~8% (183ms -> 168ms)

title: Upgrade react-native-reanimated and react-native-worklets

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

labels.name: Bug
labels.description: Something is broken. Auto assigns a BugZero manager.

body:
### Problem
Our current versions of react-native-reanimated and react-native-worklets are incompatible with React Native 0.82.

### Solution
Per [this comment](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-reanimated/issues/8343#issuecomment-3386170487), upgrade react-native-reanimated to latest (at least 4.1.3) and react-native-worklets to latest (at least 0.6.1)

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @eh2077</details>

As Account A on other device, create 2 expense to Account B 2. Tap on preview and hold one of the expense -> observe there's "held this expense" system message 3. As Account B on main device, open the IOU report with Account A 4. Pay the expense and choose pay only the unheld expense -> note that a new report created with held expense 5. Open the held expense preview 6. Enable the simulate failing network request 7. Tap remove hold 8. Verify that there's error message displayed and the expense still in hold and remove button still visible 9. Navigate to Account A on another device, observe the held report page 10. Refresh the page 11. Note that there's "unheld this expense" system message ## Expected Result: As Account A should not has "unheld this expense" system message ## Actual Result: there's "unheld this expense" system message in Account A ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [x] Android: App - [x] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari - [ ] MacOS: Desktop

title: Don't inject search syntax into the NewDot search field unless the user explicitly enters it

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Daily
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: NewFeature
labels.description: Something to build that is a new item.

labels.name: Help Wanted
labels.description: Apply this label when an issue is open to proposals by contributors

body:
## Background
Coming from [this convo](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C03U7DCU4/p1762990057809999), we'd like to make the search bar cleaner when the user is clicking around and filtering within the **Reports** page of NewDot.

## Details
When you click around the different sections of the **Reports** page in NewDot, you notice that different search syntaxes populate in the search field, like so:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/c8aafb3c-65ca-467e-ab95-7659c7e0d54f

The syntaxes also populate when you set filters manually, like so:

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a25b0f72-9369-410d-9a76-885d964b89dd

## Expected result
We don't want the search field to populate with syntaxes in these cases. It should instead stay completely empty for a cleaner experience. The only case where we want search syntax in the search field is when the user enters it manually. Thanks!


cc @JmillsExpensify @trjExpensify 

<details><summary>Issue Owner</summary>Current Issue Owner: @sobitneupane</details>
